PDF (Portable Document Format) has become an essential tool for sharing and distributing documents between users. It is widely used in creating electronic documents such as eBooks, manuals, and research papers. But sometimes, you need to edit a PDF file to annotate or make some changes to the existing content. This is when a PDF editor comes in handy.

There are many paid PDF editors available in the market that offer advanced features, but not everyone can afford them. Luckily, some free PDF editors can help you to edit, add images or text, and modify PDF files without spending a single dime. In this article, we’ll review some of the top free PDF editors available.

## 1\. PDF\-XChange Editor

PDF-XChange Editor is a free PDF editor that is loaded with features for annotating, commenting, and editing PDF files. You can add notes, highlight, and underline text or images, and even create text boxes. It also includes OCR technology that can convert scanned documents into editable text. You can even fill out forms or create your own form templates.

## 2\. LibreOffice Draw

LibreOffice Draw is a free vector graphics editor that has the capability to edit PDF files. With this program, you can add and remove text, images, and shapes. It also supports annotations, comments, and highlighting. You can use it to create flowcharts, diagrams, and other graphics that can be saved as PDF files.

## 3\. Inkscape

Inkscape is a powerful open-source vector graphics editor that can be used to edit or create PDF files. It has many features such as adding, deleting, or modifying objects, drawing shapes, and creating text. It also supports advanced features like layers, gradients, and opacity. Although it is not primarily designed for PDF editing, it is still a great tool for people who need to make minor changes or for those who want to create a high-quality PDF from scratch.

## 4\. PDFsam Basic

PDFsam Basic is a free PDF editor, designed to split, merge, extract or rotate PDF files. With this program, you can split a large PDF into multiple smaller files or combine multiple PDF files into one document. You can also extract specific pages or rotate a page in a PDF file.

## 5\. GIMP

GIMP stands for “GNU Image Manipulation Program”, and it is a free open-source image editor that can also edit PDF files. With GIMP, you can add and remove text or images, crop or resize parts of a PDF, or create new elements within the file. It also supports color adjustment, layers, and filters.

## Conclusion

In summary, a PDF editor is an essential tool for editing or annotating PDF files. There are both paid and free options available, but if you’re on a tight budget, you can still find a decent free PDF editor that suits your needs. PDF-XChange Editor, LibreOffice Draw, Inkscape, PDFsam Basic, and GIMP are all great programs that offer a variety of features for free. Whether you need to split, merge or annotate PDFs, the software mentioned in this article has got you covered.
